organization.fullName: Weill Medical College of Cornell University

identificationModule.briefTitle: Switch to Bictegravir/Emtricitabine/Tenofovir Alafenamide (BIC/F/TAF) After Renal Transplant
identificationModule.officialTitle: The Efficacy, Safety, and Tolerability of Switching to a Bictegravir (BIC)/Emtricitabine(FTC)/Tenofovir Alafenamide (TAF) Regimen in Virally Suppressed Human Immunodeficiency Viruses (HIV)-Positive Patients Post-Renal Transplant

leadSponsor.name: Weill Medical College of Cornell University

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This is an open-label study, where participants will be switched from their current HIV medication to the study drug, BIC/F/TAF. Open-label means both the investigator and the participant will know what drug will be given. Participants will be followed for 48 weeks in order to monitor the efficacy, safety and tolerability of BIC/F/TAF. The investigator hypothesizes that BIC/F/TAF will be an important addition to the management of HIV-positive post renal transplant patients, especially since it is a one pill daily dosing regimen, thereby decreasing the pill burden in this population.

armGroups.label: Bictegravir/Emtricitabine/Tenofovir Alafenamide (BIC/F/TAF)
armGroups.description: Participants receive a BIC/F/TAF tablet orally once daily with or without food.

interventions.name: BIC/F/TAF 50Mg-200Mg-25Mg Tablet
interventions.description: A three-drug fixed dose combination tablet containing 50mg of bictegravir, 200mg of emtricitabine, and 25mg of tenofovir alafenamide.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Subjects With Plasma HIV-1 Ribonucleic Acid (RNA) <50 Copies/ml
primaryOutcomes.description: HIV viral loads will be obtained from lab reports.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Safety (Tolerability) as Measured by the Number of Subjects Who Had a Serious Adverse Event (SAE)
Intracellular TAF Levels as Measured by Dried Blood Spot
primaryOutcomes.description: Fmol/punch refers to the concentration of a substance, measured in femtomoles per a specific size of a dried blood spot (DBS) punch.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Intracellular TAF Levels as Measured by Peripheral Blood Mononuclear Cells (PBMCs)
primaryOutcomes.description: pmol/10\^6 cells refers to the amount of a particular substance (in picomoles) per one million cells

primaryOutcomes.measure: Renal Function as Measured by Blood Urea Nitrogen (BUN)
Renal Function as Measured by Creatinine
Renal Function as Measured by Creatinine Clearance
Renal Function as Measured by Estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate (eGFR)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change From Baseline CD4+ T Lymphocyte Numbers Post Renal Transplant
secondaryOutcomes.description: Number of CD4+ T lymphocyte counts will be obtained from lab reports
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Day 1 (Baseline), Week 4, Week 12, Week 24, Week 36, Week 48 (End of study)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change From Baseline CD4+ T Lymphocyte Percentages Post Renal Transplant
secondaryOutcomes.description: CD4+ T lymphocyte percentages will be obtained from lab reports
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Day 1 (Baseline), Week 4, Week 12, Week 24, Week 36, Week 48 (End of study)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Subjects With Rejection of the Kidney Transplant, Post Renal Transplant
secondaryOutcomes.description: Data for kidney graft rejection will be extracted from biopsy confirmed rejections.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Participant Satisfaction With Reduced Pill Burden and Adverse Events (Tolerability) Measured by the Health-related Quality of Life Questionnaire
secondaryOutcomes.description: Satisfaction will be measured by the self-reporting health-related quality of life questionnaire ranging from 0 to 6 with higher scores indicating greater satisfaction with Biktarvy.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* At least 18 years old on day of signing informed consent
* Positive for human immunodeficiency virus (HIV)
* Received a previous renal transplant
* Must have controlled HIV infection for at least 3 months prior to enrollment

Exclusion Criteria:

* Received a kidney from a donor who was HIV positive (unless a false positive)
* Currently taking BIC/F/TAF for treatment of HIV
* Has allergies to any of the HIV medications in BIC/F/TAF (bictegravir, emtricitabine, or tenofovir alafenamide)
* Currently taking dofetilide or rifampin
* Is pregnant or breastfeeding

limitationsAndCaveats.description: The sample size was not sufficient for the statistical analysis plan as written, and, therefore, only descriptive statistics can be presented for the study.
